What is the role of mesocavities with microwindows in MOFs?
data.answer: They stabilize MOFs with high surface areas.

data.question: True or False: PCN-60 is more stable than PCN-61 upon removal of guest molecules.
What is the synthesis temperature for PCN-66?
How does the surface area of PCN-66 compare to PCN-61?
data.answer: PCN-66 has a higher surface area than PCN-61.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of PCN-61 requires Cu(NO3)2·2.5H2O.
What is the crystal system of PCN-60?
True or False: The ligand extension leads to decreased surface area in MOFs.
What is the role of H6btei in the synthesis of PCN-60?
data.answer: It is a ligand used in the synthesis.

data.question: True or False: PCN-66 was synthesized at a higher temperature than PCN-61.
What is the significance of the (3,24)-connected network in MOFs?
data.answer: It allows for the incorporation of mesocavities with microwindows, contributing to stability and high surface area.

data.question: True or False: All MOFs mentioned in the study have the same crystal system.
What is the role of CuCl2·2H2O in the synthesis of PCN-66?
data.answer: It is a copper salt used as a reactant.

data.question: True or False: The removal of guest molecules always decreases the surface area of MOFs.
How does the use of rigid ligands affect the stability of MOFs?
data.answer: Rigid ligands increase the stability of MOFs.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of PCN-61 does not require HBF4.
What is the significance of the BET method in the study?
data.answer: It is used to estimate the surface areas of MOFs.

data.question: What is the effect of ligand extension on MOFs' surface area?
data.answer: Ligand extension leads to an increase in surface area.

data.question: True or False: PCN-66 has a lower surface area than MOF-5.
